alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 02 at 5:14AM EDT until July 02 at 7:15AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Clinton County in northern New York... * Until 715 AM EDT. * At 514 AM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area earlier. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. While heavy rain has ended, flooding will continue as water moves down area streams. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Merrill and Ellenburg Mountain. Route 374 remains closed between Star Road and Plank Road with multiple reports of secondary roads being impacted. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads and obey all road closure signage. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
